intro: Hieracium brevifolium var. halimifolium, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a rosette of basal leaves and a flowering stem that is often covered in fine, white hairs. This variety is known for its compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
